<<<<<<< HEAD
The complaint of peace. Wryten in Latyn, by the famous clerke, Erasimus [sic] Roterodamus. And nuely translated into Englyshe by Thomas Paynell. Querela pacis. Selections. English Erasmus, Desiderius, d. 1536. Paynell, Thomas.
[96] p.
In Paules Churchyard, by Ihon Cawoode, one of the prynters to the Quenes Maiestye], [Imprinted at London : Anno domini 1559.
A translation, by Thomas Paynell, of a selection from: Erasmus, Desiderius. Querela pacis. Imprint from colophon. Running title reads: The complaynt of peace. Signatures: A-F. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[96] p.
In Paules Churchyard, by Ihon Cawoode, one of the prynters to the Quenes Maiestye], [Imprinted at London : Anno domini 1559.
A translation, by Thomas Paynell, of a selection from: Erasmus, Desiderius. Querela pacis. Imprint from colophon. Running title reads: The complaynt of peace. Signatures: A-F. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
